<item>
	<title>New Brunswick teen behind viral online kindness campaign dies of brain cancer </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/18/new-brunswick-teen-behind-viral-online-kindness-campaign-dies-of-brain-cancer.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">3a7a401b-8399-4c4d-9641-063ee91d0693</guid>
	<author>The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:23:45 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/18/new-brunswick-teen-behind-viral-online-kindness-campaign-dies-of-brain-cancer/rebecca1_jpg.jpg"/><br/>After finding out her cancer was terminal in 2016, Rebecca Schofield started the #BeccaToldMeTo campaign.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/18/new-brunswick-teen-behind-viral-online-kindness-campaign-dies-of-brain-cancer/rebecca1_jpg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>New Brunswick teen behind viral online kindness campaign dies of brain cancer </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/18/new-brunswick-teen-behind-viral-online-kindness-campaign-dies-of-brain-cancer/rebecca1_jpg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Rebecca Schofield, 18, died in Moncton Saturday from brain cancer.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>What will Meghan Markle wear on her big day? The royal wedding dress is a top secret</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/18/what-will-meghan-markle-wear-on-her-big-day-the-royal-wedding-dress-is-a-top-secret.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">05506469-1005-4d58-8ca1-4a7d54090924</guid>
	<author>Sylvia Hui - The Associated Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:38:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/18/what-will-meghan-markle-wear-on-her-big-day-the-royal-wedding-dress-is-a-top-secret/markle.jpg"/><br/>With only a few months to go until the royal wedding, the U.K. fashion world is abuzz with talk of who will design Markle’s dress, and what it will look like. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/18/what-will-meghan-markle-wear-on-her-big-day-the-royal-wedding-dress-is-a-top-secret/markle.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>What will Meghan Markle wear on her big day? The royal wedding dress is a top secret</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/18/what-will-meghan-markle-wear-on-her-big-day-the-royal-wedding-dress-is-a-top-secret/markle.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Markle will wed Prince Harry on May 19 at Windsor Castle.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Chris Jackson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Getty Images</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Senegalese man sues Quebec Catholic group for alleged sexual abuse in Africa</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/18/senegalese-man-sues-quebec-catholic-group-for-alleged-sexual-abuse-in-africa.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">c71a2e22-de05-497d-9ba7-df91ab1e07a2</guid>
	<author>Giuseppe Valiante - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 07:50:38 EST</pubDate>
	<description>The man is suing a Quebec-based congregation for $1.4 million, alleging one of its brothers sexually abused him in Senegal during the 1980s. </description>

</item>
<item>
	<title>Protocols needed for care of intoxicated patients after Indigenous woman’s death, inquest says</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/17/protocols-needed-for-care-of-intoxicated-patients-after-indigenous-womans-death-inquest-says.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">f004a681-742d-4e4a-8e76-548b1dd7be89</guid>
	<author>Michelle McQuigge - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 22:04:58 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/protocols-needed-for-care-of-intoxicated-patients-after-indigenous-womans-death-inquest-says/inquest.jpg"/><br/>Jurors heard nurses told police to bring Matawapit back for a medical assessment only after she had sobered up from a recent bout of drinking. The 37-year-old died of heart failure hours after she was turned away.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/protocols-needed-for-care-of-intoxicated-patients-after-indigenous-womans-death-inquest-says/inquest.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Protocols needed for care of intoxicated patients after Indigenous woman’s death, inquest says</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/protocols-needed-for-care-of-intoxicated-patients-after-indigenous-womans-death-inquest-says/inquest.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Emily Hill of Aboriginal Legal Servicesl said the treatment provided to Ina Matawapit — pictured with her parents Madeline and Edward Metawapit — fell well short of clinical standards, which dictate that patients in such circumstances should receive a full respiratory, neurological and cardiac evaluation.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Aboriginal Legal Services</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh focuses on inequality in party convention speech</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/17/ndp-leader-jagmeet-singh-focuses-on-inequality-in-party-convention-speech.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">af480460-66a5-4204-825f-a7b2f8033147</guid>
	<author>Alex Ballingall - Ottawa Bureau</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 20:09:36 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/ndp-leader-jagmeet-singh-focuses-on-inequality-in-party-convention-speech/ndp_singh.jpg"/><br/>Singh delivered the keynote address at the convention Saturday, when 91 per cent of delegates voted to support his leadership as the party positions itself for the 2019 federal election.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/ndp-leader-jagmeet-singh-focuses-on-inequality-in-party-convention-speech/ndp_singh.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh focuses on inequality in party convention speech</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/ndp-leader-jagmeet-singh-focuses-on-inequality-in-party-convention-speech/ndp_singh.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>“Government belongs to us and it should be making choices that build an economy that works better for all of us,” NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh told the Federal NDP Convention in Ottawa Saturday.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Justin Tang</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/ndp-leader-jagmeet-singh-focuses-on-inequality-in-party-convention-speech/ndp_singh_3.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh focuses on inequality in party convention speech</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/ndp-leader-jagmeet-singh-focuses-on-inequality-in-party-convention-speech/ndp_singh_3.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh lamented what he described as a concentration of wealth in the top 1 per cent of income earners and pledged to close the wage gap between men and women.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Justin Tang</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Vancouver artist’s cartoon of Florida school shooting resonates </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/17/vancouver-artists-cartoon-of-florida-school-shooting-resonates.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">ac08731f-b4b9-4392-b521-003950ebb002</guid>
	<author>Amy Smart - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:38:57 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/vancouver-artists-cartoon-of-florida-school-shooting-resonates/vancouver_comic.jpg"/><br/>Pia Guerra's cartoon depicts football coach Aaron Feis, one of the 17 victims who died when a former student opened fire at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fla.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/vancouver-artists-cartoon-of-florida-school-shooting-resonates/vancouver_comic.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Vancouver artist’s cartoon of Florida school shooting resonates </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/vancouver-artists-cartoon-of-florida-school-shooting-resonates/vancouver_comic.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Vancouver artist Pia Guerra’s "Hero’s Welcome" shows a young girl leading shooting victim Aaron Feis by the hand to meet a crowd of other people killed in school shootings.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Pia Guerra</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Former NDP MP Paul Dewar diagnosed with cancer</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/17/former-ottawa-mp-paul-dewar-diagnosed-with-cancer.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">ecb0efae-0c0e-4af7-baf0-c6bd1b362591</guid>
	<author>Alex Ballingall - Ottawa Bureau</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 11:26:51 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/former-ottawa-mp-paul-dewar-diagnosed-with-cancer/dewar.jpg"/><br/>In a Facebook post, Dewar said he went to Ottawa Civic Hospital to have his arm examined. X-rays and a CT scan later revealed a cyst on the right side of his brain.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/former-ottawa-mp-paul-dewar-diagnosed-with-cancer/dewar.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Former NDP MP Paul Dewar diagnosed with cancer</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/former-ottawa-mp-paul-dewar-diagnosed-with-cancer/dewar.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Paul Dewar was first elected to the House of Commons in 2006 and represented his downtown Ottawa riding until 2015. His cancer diagnosis has prompted emotional responses from MPs and staff.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">FRED CHARTRAND</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Trudeau family arrives in India for state visit</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/17/trudeau-family-arrives-in-india-for-state-visit.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">f6687297-500d-4713-875d-f5509d8efb95</guid>
	<author>Mia Rabson - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 10:38:56 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/trudeau-family-arrives-in-india-for-state-visit/trudeau_family_india.jpg"/><br/>The seven-day Indian state visit is a mix of business meetings, round tables on education, women’s rights and human rights, tours of popular Indian sites and a meeting with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/trudeau-family-arrives-in-india-for-state-visit/trudeau_family_india.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Trudeau family arrives in India for state visit</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/trudeau-family-arrives-in-india-for-state-visit/trudeau_family_india.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his wife Sophie Gregoire Trudeau, and children, Xavier, 10, Ella-Grace, 9, and Hadrien, 3, arrive in New Delhi, India, on Saturday, Feb. 17, 2018.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Sean Kilpatrick</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Retired Alberta dentist cited after young girl left with brain damage following dental procedure </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/17/retired-alberta-dentist-cited-after-young-girl-left-with-brain-damage-following-dental-procedure.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">b2f0a013-da66-4846-a518-72d4674d311b</guid>
	<author>The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 10:21:51 EST</pubDate>
	<description>An Alberta Dental Association and College tribunal says Dr. William Mather failed in his duties.</description>

</item>
<item>
	<title>Canadian military looking for DNA experts, funeral organizers to help identify, memorialize missing war dead</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/17/canadian-military-looking-for-dna-experts-funeral-organizers-to-help-identify-memorialize-missing-war-dead.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">f2b0bf1f-6818-4fef-930a-895d7bd22fca</guid>
	<author>Levi Garber - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 08:49:53 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/canadian-military-looking-for-dna-experts-funeral-organizers-to-help-identify-memorialize-missing-war-dead/sarah_lockyer_file_photo.jpg"/><br/>Since 2015, the remains of 22 Canadian Armed Forces service members have been discovered, including one found earlier this month near the French city of Lens. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/canadian-military-looking-for-dna-experts-funeral-organizers-to-help-identify-memorialize-missing-war-dead/sarah_lockyer_file_photo.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Canadian military looking for DNA experts, funeral organizers to help identify, memorialize missing war dead</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/17/canadian-military-looking-for-dna-experts-funeral-organizers-to-help-identify-memorialize-missing-war-dead/sarah_lockyer_file_photo.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Sarah Lockyer, the head of the Defence Department's identification program, is shown in this 2016 file photo. Lockyer says, "It’s all about returning their identity and returning their name to them. Until now, they’re nameless. They’re faceless."</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Sean Kilpatrick</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS file photo</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>‘Call in the Mounties!’ — Tim Hortons confirms some Roll up the Rim cups were misprinted</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/call-in-the-mounties-tim-hortons-confirms-some-roll-up-the-rim-cups-were-misprinted.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">26ef6901-afca-4a7b-85e4-729dd667ebc8</guid>
	<author>Aly Thomson - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 23:42:26 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/call-in-the-mounties-tim-hortons-confirms-some-roll-up-the-rim-cups-were-misprinted/roll_up_the_rim.jpg"/><br/>Coffee chain confirms that some cups in Atlantic Canada and Alberta have no message at all under the rim — and can be exchanged for a beverage of the customer’s choice. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/call-in-the-mounties-tim-hortons-confirms-some-roll-up-the-rim-cups-were-misprinted/roll_up_the_rim.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>‘Call in the Mounties!’ — Tim Hortons confirms some Roll up the Rim cups were misprinted</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/call-in-the-mounties-tim-hortons-confirms-some-roll-up-the-rim-cups-were-misprinted/roll_up_the_rim.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Tim Hortons said that although some cups were printed without prize messaging, the odds of winning the major prizes from Roll Up the Rim were not affected.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Nathan Denette</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Texas police didn’t pursue sex assault case against church gunman 4 years ago </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/texas-police-didnt-pursue-sex-assault-case-against-church-gunman-4-years-ago.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">d06d4a58-c563-41b8-8e9b-0eb4c3e8d3be</guid>
	<author>Nomaan Merchant - The Associated Press</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 20:45:33 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/texas-police-didnt-pursue-sex-assault-case-against-church-gunman-4-years-ago/church_shooting_texas.jpg"/><br/>Had Devin Patrick Kelley been prosecuted for sexual assault in 2013, a conviction could have stopped a trail of violent allegations that culminated in the shooting in November. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/texas-police-didnt-pursue-sex-assault-case-against-church-gunman-4-years-ago/church_shooting_texas.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Texas police didn’t pursue sex assault case against church gunman 4 years ago </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/texas-police-didnt-pursue-sex-assault-case-against-church-gunman-4-years-ago/church_shooting_texas.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>A Texas sheriff's office admitted "error" for not pursuing a sexual assault case against Devin Patrick Kelley in 2013. Kelley shot and killed 26 people at a Texas church in November.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">David J. Phillip</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">The ASsociated Press file photo</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>RCMP to investigate male officers’ Facebook group reportedly sharing sexual content </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/rcmp-to-investigate-male-officers-facebook-group-reportedly-sharing-sexual-content.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">179acda7-dae2-473e-9c22-894f77e6359c</guid>
	<author>Jim Bronskill - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 19:28:27 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/rcmp-to-investigate-male-officers-facebook-group-reportedly-sharing-sexual-content/rcmp_car.jpg"/><br/>Meanwhile, an RCMP member who was fined for disgraceful conduct in the workplace has launched a fresh court challenge to prevent further disciplinary actions against him.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/rcmp-to-investigate-male-officers-facebook-group-reportedly-sharing-sexual-content/rcmp_car.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>RCMP to investigate male officers’ Facebook group reportedly sharing sexual content </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/rcmp-to-investigate-male-officers-facebook-group-reportedly-sharing-sexual-content/rcmp_car.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The RCMP is looking into another Facebook group that was set up for male officers. The group reportedly had sexually suggestive content that angered female colleagues.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">FRED CHARTRAND</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS FILE PHOTO</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Man charged in 2013 swarming death returns to Calgary after arrest in Vietnam </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/man-charged-in-2013-swarming-death-returns-to-calgary-after-arrest-in-vietnam.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">41248ad0-bdb8-435b-a3a5-dda357800a5d</guid>
	<author>The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:05:31 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/man-charged-in-2013-swarming-death-returns-to-calgary-after-arrest-in-vietnam/calgary_police.jpg"/><br/>Nathan Gervais is accused in the 2013 death of Lukas Strasser-Hird, who was stabbed, beaten and kicked outside of a Calgary bar and later died of his injuries. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/man-charged-in-2013-swarming-death-returns-to-calgary-after-arrest-in-vietnam/calgary_police.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Man charged in 2013 swarming death returns to Calgary after arrest in Vietnam </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/man-charged-in-2013-swarming-death-returns-to-calgary-after-arrest-in-vietnam/calgary_police.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Calgary police say Lukas Strasser-Hird's family is aware of the arrest of the arrest of Nathan Gervais.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Larry MacDougal</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS file photo</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Peeing in the seats? Military eyes air force alcohol ban after troubled VIP trip</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/peeing-in-the-seats-military-eyes-air-force-alcohol-ban-after-troubled-vip-trip.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">ee264e02-bc56-458c-8cf5-5dea1ef7afaf</guid>
	<author>Bruce Campion-Smith - Ottawa Bureau</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 17:10:21 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/peeing-in-the-seats-military-eyes-air-force-alcohol-ban-after-troubled-vip-trip/gen_jonathan_vance.jpg"/><br/>A pre-Christmas trip of sports stars and senior military personnel was supposed to boost the morale of overseas troops. Instead, the trip to Athens has led to an allegation of assault and complaints of drunken, boorish behaviour.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/peeing-in-the-seats-military-eyes-air-force-alcohol-ban-after-troubled-vip-trip/gen_jonathan_vance.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Peeing in the seats? Military eyes air force alcohol ban after troubled VIP trip</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/peeing-in-the-seats-military-eyes-air-force-alcohol-ban-after-troubled-vip-trip/gen_jonathan_vance.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Gen. Jonathan Vance, seen here in June 8, 2017, has been on Team Canada goodwill  trips before but skipped the pre-Christmas one because of a scheduling conflict. He is said to be "extremely unhappy" about complaints of drunken behaviour during the trip.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Justin Tang</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Morneau says Canada won’t act in ‘impulsive way’ in response to U.S. corporate tax cuts</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/monreau-says-canada-wont-act-in-impulsive-way-in-response-to-us-corporate-tax-cuts.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">f940bd15-9b5e-4bf7-9214-33ed42b61309</guid>
	<author>The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:14:54 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/monreau-says-canada-wont-act-in-impulsive-way-in-response-to-us-corporate-tax-cuts/morneau_economists.jpg"/><br/>Federal Finance Minister Bill Morneau met with private sector economists in Toronto Friday. “We will carefully consider the U.S. changes and the international situation to make sure that our economy is competitive,” he said.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/monreau-says-canada-wont-act-in-impulsive-way-in-response-to-us-corporate-tax-cuts/morneau_economists.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Morneau says Canada won’t act in ‘impulsive way’ in response to U.S. corporate tax cuts</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/monreau-says-canada-wont-act-in-impulsive-way-in-response-to-us-corporate-tax-cuts/morneau_economists.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Minister of Finance Bill Morneau, shown after meeting with economists on Feb. 16, would not comment on whether tax cuts are in the cards for large Canadian corporations.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Christopher Katsarov</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Manitoba ’60s Scoop survivors urging others to opt out of federal settlement</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/manitoba-60s-scoop-survivors-urging-others-to-opt-out-of-federal-settlement.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">276bcf1d-b5f4-443f-97b1-3e54815aff26</guid>
	<author>Kelly Geraldine Malone - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 13:58:35 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/manitoba-60s-scoop-survivors-urging-others-to-opt-out-of-federal-settlement/_60s_scoop_settlement_mb.jpg"/><br/>The survivors say they weren’t consulted on the settlement and will wind up with less money than the lawyers involved.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/manitoba-60s-scoop-survivors-urging-others-to-opt-out-of-federal-settlement/_60s_scoop_settlement_mb.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Manitoba ’60s Scoop survivors urging others to opt out of federal settlement</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/manitoba-60s-scoop-survivors-urging-others-to-opt-out-of-federal-settlement/_60s_scoop_settlement_mb.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Priscilla Meeches was taken from her family in 1969 in Portage La Prairie, Man., and adopted to a Manitoba Mennonite family. She is part of a group of survivors meeting to discuss rejecting a settlement with the federal government.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">John Woods</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>NDP addresses harassment policy, ‘precarious’ finances, as national convention begins in Ottawa</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/two-ndp-riding-associations-want-to-put-socialism-back-in-the-party-constitution.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">28901ae1-8198-494d-b37a-5b355173b4c1</guid>
	<author>Alex Ballingall - Ottawa Bureau</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 11:51:45 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/two-ndp-riding-associations-want-to-put-socialism-back-in-the-party-constitution/tom_mulcair.jpg"/><br/>The three-day event will include a host of policy debates and a speech from party leader Jagmeet Singh.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/two-ndp-riding-associations-want-to-put-socialism-back-in-the-party-constitution/tom_mulcair.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>NDP addresses harassment policy, ‘precarious’ finances, as national convention begins in Ottawa</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/two-ndp-riding-associations-want-to-put-socialism-back-in-the-party-constitution/tom_mulcair.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Former federal NDP leader Tom Mulcair during question period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Sept. 19, 2017. Mulcair was leader when the NDP voted to remove the word socialism from its constitution.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Sean Kilpatrick</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Garneau orders officials to explore all options to crack down on people aiming laser pointers at planes </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/16/garneau-orders-officials-to-explore-all-options-to-crack-down-on-people-aiming-laser-pointers-at-planes.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">37cb2390-24ed-407a-a643-629789a1d24e</guid>
	<author>Joan Bryden - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 07:43:35 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/garneau-orders-officials-to-explore-all-options-to-crack-down-on-people-aiming-laser-pointers-at-planes/garneau_2.jpg"/><br/>A laser pointed into the cockpit of an aircraft can distract, disorient or even temporarily blind a pilot.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/garneau-orders-officials-to-explore-all-options-to-crack-down-on-people-aiming-laser-pointers-at-planes/garneau_2.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Garneau orders officials to explore all options to crack down on people aiming laser pointers at planes </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/16/garneau-orders-officials-to-explore-all-options-to-crack-down-on-people-aiming-laser-pointers-at-planes/garneau_2.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>“This is not only reckless, it is criminal and it is absolutely essential that we bring those numbers down because one is too many, there’s no question about it,” Transport Minister Marc Garneau said in an interview.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Justin Tang</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Senate deal to vote on pot bill on June 7 means no sales before August</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2018/02/15/senate-deal-to-vote-on-pot-bill-on-june-7-means-no-sales-before-august.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">3257a7fc-d1a2-4b32-b9bf-fc23ccdece5c</guid>
	<author>Joan Bryden - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 22:08:46 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/15/senate-deal-to-vote-on-pot-bill-on-june-7-means-no-sales-before-august/petitpas_taylor.jpg"/><br/>If Bill C-45 is passed by the Senate by June 7, royal assent would follow almost immediately. But it would take another two or three months before legal weed was available for purchase.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/15/senate-deal-to-vote-on-pot-bill-on-june-7-means-no-sales-before-august/petitpas_taylor.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Senate deal to vote on pot bill on June 7 means no sales before August</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/news/canada/2018/02/15/senate-deal-to-vote-on-pot-bill-on-june-7-means-no-sales-before-august/petitpas_taylor.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Health Minister Ginette Petitpas Taylor said legal cannabis will go on sale in all provinces and territories at the same time, which suggests if just one of them requires the full 12 weeks to get ready, they’ll all have to wait.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Justin Tang</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
</channel></rss>
